item.title: Afghan girls school ban would be un-Islamic, Pakistan PM says
item.description: Prime Minister Imran Khan speaks to the BBC's John Simpson about events in neighbouring Afghanistan.

item.title: President Biden urges unity in first UN speech amid tensions with allies
item.description: Joe Biden called for cooperation in his first speech as US president to the UN General Assembly.

item.title: Canary Islands volcano: Hundreds more evacuated as La Palma lava nears sea
item.description: Officials fear lava could trigger toxic gasses when it reaches the sea on the Canary Islands resort.

item.title: Canary Islands volcano: BBC reporter on the evacuation of La Palma residents
item.description: The BBC reports on the evacuation of hundreds of homes in the path of an erupting volcano on La Palma.

item.title: Third Russian accused by UK police of poison attack
item.description: Denis Sergeev is thought to have been the on-the-ground commander for the 2018 poisonings.

item.title: Russian students grieve after deadly Perm university attack
item.description: The city of Perm is holding a day of mourning after a gunman killed six people, including teenagers.

item.title: Pew study: Little change in India's religious make-up in 70 years
item.description: The population trebled in 70 years but saw few changes to its religious composition, a study shows.

item.title: Canada election: Trudeau stays in power but Liberals fall short of majority
item.description: His Liberal Party retains power but he fails to secure the majority he wanted when calling the snap election.

item.title: Abba's Bjorn Ulvaeus launches campaign to fix Â£500m music royalty problem
item.description: Bjorn Ulvaeus launches a campaign to ensure musicians don't miss out on unpaid royalties.

item.title: Record backlog of cargo ships at California ports
item.description: Some 65 container ships are stuck outside the ports of Los Angeles and Long Beach, amid trade bottlenecks.

item.title: CIA officer 'suffered from Havana syndrome' during India trip
item.description: US media say the officer fell ill while visiting India with CIA Director William Burns this month.

item.title: Migrants in Texas: US probes horseback charge on Haiti migrants
item.description: Images which seem to show border agents on horseback driving migrants back spark an investigation.

item.title: Mundra Port: Nearly three tonnes of heroin seized at Gujarat port
item.description: The seized drugs reportedly have a street value of more than $2.7bn.

item.title: New Zealand Covid: Men caught smuggling KFC into lockdown-hit Auckland
item.description: The pair, who were also carrying large amounts of cash, could face six months in prison.

item.title: Russia behind Litvinenko murder, rules European rights court
item.description: The former Russian spy, who became a British citizen, was poisoned in London with polonium in 2006.

item.title: Afghanistan: Fighting off hunger under the Taliban
item.description: For most Afghans staving off starvation is the biggest challenge since the Taliban returned to power.

item.title: World War Two: The brothers who fled Nazi occupation by kayak
item.description: The "Engelandvaarders" who paddled from the Netherlands to England 80 years ago.

item.title: Twitch hate raids: Minority streamers have 'a target on their back'
item.description: Streamers tell Newsbeat about the targeted hate they get and what they want Twitch to do about it.

item.title: How 'nerd' culture powered through the pandemic
item.description: Meet the online content creators beating the odds to build successful careers from their passions.

item.title: Cambodia: The autistic teenager jailed over a Telegram post
item.description: He allegedly insulted Cambodia's government, prompting heavily-armed policemen to arrest him.

item.title: The mother and son who waited 58 years for a hug
item.description: Calvin Barrett flies from the US to the UK to meet his "Ma" after tracing her through a DNA test.

item.title: Hotel Rwanda hero Paul Rusesabagina convicted on terror charges
item.description: A Rwandan court sentences Paul Rusesabagina to 25 years for supporting a terrorist group.

item.title: Gabby Petito: What do we know about the case so far?
item.description: A body matching Gabby Petito's description was found on Sunday, while her fiancÃ© remains missing.

item.title: Paul Rusesabagina: From Hotel Rwanda hero to convicted terrorist
item.description: Paul Rusesabagina, who was portrayed in Hotel Rwanda, has gone from national hero to enemy of the state.

item.title: Imran Khan: Afghan women 'are very strong'
item.description: Pakistan's prime minster suggests that, in time, women can "assert their rights" under the Taliban.

item.title: A year in Calais: One migrantâs year-long attempt to cross the Channel
item.description: The BBC followed Iranian migrant Alex, as he tried to cross from France to the UK with a smuggler.

item.title: La Palma volcano: Lava destroys homes in the Canary Islands
item.description: A volcanic eruption on the Spanish island of La Palma has demolished homes and caused evacuations.

item.title: Fauci looks to boost vaccines as US infections rise
item.description: The US daily death toll from Covid-19 has risen above 2,000 for the first time since February.
